visualization_prompt: Generate a spline chart showing monthly precipitation patterns using synthetic meteorological data with seasonal variation
visualization_explanation: The dataset represents a univariate time series with 12 temporal data points (monthly measurements). Synthetic precipitation values were generated with μ=125mm, σ=55mm, exhibiting bimodal distribution peaking in June and September to simulate Mediterranean climate patterns. The spline chart maximizes data-ink ratio by eliminating gridlines while maintaining temporal continuity perception. Color contrast between the teal series and light background adheres to Cairo's salience principles. Axis labels use ordinal positioning with categorical month labels, while the y-axis maintains proportional spacing for quantitative measurements. Trend annotation through spline interpolation helps viewers perceive the dual-peak seasonal pattern characteristic of synthetic data modeling.
